ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] (OT) Squad Ring Quest
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually I found this to be one of the more satisfying and logical quests out there in the early days.  Compared to the rusty weapons most quests gave you back
ygData.messageBody:
Actually I found this to be one of the more satisfying and logical quests
out there in the early days. Compared to the rusty weapons most quests gave
you back then the Squad Ring was awesome. It was quite a badge of honor
back then since you had to devote a lot of time to keeping Rivervale free of
goblins and orcs to get one. The 100pt heal may not sound like much to us
now, but I was only 9th level when I got it and it definitely saved my life
more than a dozen times back then. It also allowed me to help others in
trouble who were not in my group for the first time.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Talies the Wanderer [mailto:snicker@...]
Sent: Wednesday, 30 May, 2001 8:43 AM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] (OT) Squad Ring Quest


At 10:21 AM 5/30/2001 -0400, you wrote:

>Does killing tougher things increase faction more? Like the difference
>between killing a goblin and a goblin shaman, for example? Same faction
>hits and increases, just wondering if it was larger?


There is no direct relationship between the difficulty of a monster and the
value of related faction hits. That being said, it should be noted that
Mooto DOES give a significantly higher faction increase - but this is
intentional - not a function of math ;)

Talies the Wanderer
